Home

These web pages describe a collaborative project between the Institute of Mathematics, Statistics and Actuarial Science (IMSAS) and the Department of Biosciences at the University of Kent.

 

The broad aim of the work is to use stochastic modelling techniques to improve our understanding of prion proteins in the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae. These pages describe the biological background to the work and outline the models that we have developed.

 

The project has been funded by a BBSRC grant to Byron Morgan (IMSAS), Martin Ridout (IMSAS) and Mick Tuite (Biosciences), supporting the work of Lee Byrne (Biosciences) and Diana Cole (IMSAS).
